curl_command: This reference guide provides general information about the Bullhorn REST API and specific information about each API operation and supported entity type.
description: Other Guides: - Entity Reference Guide available: here

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Name of a configured layout. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: clientCorpId
parameters.description: id of a ClientCorporation entity.

parameters.name: Param
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Name of a configured layout. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: off, basic, or full. Default is off (no meta). Returns metadata that describes the structure of returned entity data. For more information, see Meta.

parameters.name: privateLabelId
parameters.description: Integer. Default is primary private label ID. Filters results based on the specified primary or secondary private label ID.

parameters.name: showEditable
parameters.description: Default value is false. Whether to show the _editable field in responses. The _editable field indicates whether an entity is editable. Setting showEditable to true results in slower performance; use this setting sparingly and only when needed.

parameters.name: showReadOnly
parameters.description: Whether to show read-only fields. Only applies when the layout parameter is used. NOTE: Read-only fields inside of composite properties (Address is the only instance of a composite property) do not obey visibility rules right now. They will always show, regardless of this setting. This is a known issue and there are plans to fix it in a future release.}}

This is a known issue and there are plans to fix it in a future release.}}

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Name of a configured layout. fields or layout is required.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: departmentIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of department ids. When not specified, the call returns entities from all of the user’s departments.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limit on the number of entities to return. If the set of matched results is larger than the count value, the returned results is capped at the count value. The default count is 20. The maximum count is 500; if you specify a count greater than 500, a message at the end of the response indicates you have specified too many items. The response also includes the actual number of items returned and the start value of the request. This is useful when you want to make calls to page additional sets of data.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: From the set of matched results, returns item numbers start through (start + count).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort result on. Precede with minus sign to perform ascending search. Applies to Candidate and Note entities only.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Lucene query string. Applies to Candidate and Note entities only.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: JPQL query string. Does not apply to Candidate or Note entities.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: off, basic, or full. Default is off (no meta). Returns metadata that describes the structure of returned entity data.

parameters.name: showEditable
parameters.description: Default value is false. Whether to show the _editable field in responses. The _editable field indicates whether an entity is editable. Setting showEditable to true results in slower performance; use this setting sparingly and only when needed.

parameters.name: externalID
parameters.description: External identifier for the file.

parameters.name: fileContent
parameters.description: Base64-encoded string of the file content.

parameters.name: fileExtension
parameters.description: Extension of the file. For example, .doc or .jpg.

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: Always use the value “SAMPLE”.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: File name. If a file extension is included as part of the name and the fileExtension field is not set, the file extension in the name is used.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description of the file.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Type/subtype of the file content.type

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter on the label, prefix with an asterisk (*) to find word begins. For example, filter=foo returns all options where label starts with “foo”, such as “Fool”. filter=*foo returns all options where any word in the label starts with “foo”, such as “A Fool”. Some labels are composed of two or more parts. For example, a name is composed of firstname and lastname separated by a space. In these cases, filtering is based on each part of the label. For example, filter=Ba, will find any part of a label that starts with Ba. Therefore, the results could include “Bailey Hutchinson” as well as “Sam Bailey”.

parameters.name: type-specific parameters
parameters.description: Some option types accept additional parameters. For example, State has an optional “country” parameter.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limit on the number of entities to return. If the set of matched results is larger than count, caps the returned results at size count. The default count is 20. The maximum count is 300; if you specify a count greater than 300, a message at the end of the response indicates you have specified too many items.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: From the set of matched results, return item numbers start through (start + count).

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: BhRestToken

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: SQL-style filter clause

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names. Use fields or layout, but not both.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Name of a configured layout. Use fields or layout, but not both.

parameters.name: showReadOnly
parameters.description: Whether to show read-only fields. Only applies when the layout parameter is used.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limit on the number of records to return. If the set of matched results is larger than count, cap the returned results at size count.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: From the set of matched results, return record numbers start through (start + count)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Name of property on which to base the order of returned entities.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: off, basic, or full. Default is off (no meta). Returns metadata that describes the structure of returned entity data.

parameters.name: privateLabelId
parameters.description: Integer. Default is primary private label ID. Filters results based on the specified primary or secondary private label ID.

parameters.name: showEditable
parameters.description: Whether to show the _editable field in responses. The _editable field indicates whether an entity is editable. Default value is false.

parameters.name: totalOnly
parameters.description: When set to true, only the total count of records matching the where parameter is returned. In this scenario, only the where parameter is required and all others are ignored.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Input format for the resume. Value can be html or text.

parameters.name: populateDescription
parameters.description: Including this parameter fills the Candidate description field with the text or html format of the resume. Value must be text or html. The primary use case for this parameter is to send the resume in the description field for a new Candidate in a PUT /entity/Candidate call. The text or HTML content returned in the description field of the response is JSON-encoded. When the resume is used in a request body, it must be JSON-encoded. If you have parsed the response to an object for manipulation, you must re-encode the value of the “description” as JSON before using it in a request body of another call. For example, in Groovy you can use the groovy.json.JsonOutput.toJson(java.lang.String s) method to Json-encode a string.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: populateDescription

The primary use case for this parameter is to send the resume in the description field for a new Candidate in a PUT /entity/Candidate call. The text or HTML content returned in the description field of the response is JSON-encoded. When the resume is used in a request body, it must be JSON-encoded. If you have parsed the response to an object for manipulation, you must re-encode the value of the “description” as JSON before using it in a request body of another call. For example, in Groovy you can use the groovy.json.JsonOutput.toJson(java.lang.String s) method to Json-encode a string.

parameters.name: privateLabelId
parameters.description: Integer. Default is primary private label ID. Filters results based on the specified primary or secondary private label ID.

parameters.name: showEditable
parameters.description: Whether to show the _editable field in responses. The _editable field indicates whether an entity is editable. Default value is false.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of field names. Use fields or layout, but not both.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Name of a configured layout. Use fields or layout, but not both.

parameters.name: showReadOnly
parameters.description: Whether to show read-only fields. Only applies when the layout parameter is used.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Limit on the number of records to return. If the set of matched results is larger than count, cap the returned results at size count.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: From the set of matched results, return record numbers start through (start + count)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Field to sort result on. Default sort order is ascending. Precede with minus sign to perform descending sort.

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: off, basic, or full. Default is off (no meta). Returns metadata that describes the structure of returned entity data. For more information, see

parameters.name: privateLabelId
parameters.description: Integer. Default is primary private label ID. Filters results based on the specified primary or secondary private label ID.

parameters.name: showEditable
parameters.description: Whether to show the _editable field in responses. The _editable field indicates whether an entity is editable. Default value is false.

parameters.name: BhRestToken
parameters.description: Token that represents a session established by the login process. Must be sent with all subsequent requests to the API. The session key can be provided in the BhRestToken query string, a cookie, or an HTTP header.

parameters.name: Parameter
parameters.description: Description

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: One of: “Candidate”, “ClientContact”, or “Lead”.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: List of IDs of the given type of entity, a maximum of 500 per call.
